item.title: @AksLolCoding commented on "Longest Increasing Subsequence (LIS)"
item.description: Your code is $$$O(n^2)$$$ but LIS can be done in $$$O(n\log{n})$$$ as shown here

item.title: @AkbarKING commented on "Mirror website automatically downloads a suspicious file"
item.description: I think it wasn't empty before. My antivirus detected it as a virus just minutes ago. They probably removed the contents, or maybe it's just another Mandela effect for me.

item.title: @gtgd commented on "Mirror website automatically downloads a suspicious file"
item.description: I also have this problem + mirror doesn't open at all for me, just downloads this empty file.

item.title: @AksLolCoding commented on "Mirror website automatically downloads a suspicious file"
item.description: The file is not malicious (it's completely empty, 0b size), but this is wierd

item.title: @_Puzzles commented on "Finally Candidate"
item.description: Anytime

item.title: @I_Love_Sabnaj commented on "Finally Candidate"
item.description: Thanks a lot.

item.title: @_Puzzles commented on "Finally Candidate"
item.description: I just select a certain rate and I type it in the filter problems section and I solve the latest problems that have this rate. because the older the problems are the easier they are. It's like a new 1600 is actually harder than an old 1800 problem. and I also hide the tags but I think everyone does this.

item.title: @I_Love_Sabnaj commented on "Finally Candidate"
item.description: I have also solved problems from USACO, but I can't improve to my expectations in Codeforces. What is your secret to selecting problems from Codeforces?

item.title: @_Puzzles commented on "Finally Candidate"
item.description: I practice mainly on CF and USACO guide and participate in contests from various sites like AtCoder , CF, USACO and others. I mainly know what contests to participate in from clist.

item.title: @I_Love_Sabnaj commented on "Finally Candidate"
item.description: Congrats _Puzzles your Effort paid off.What is your main Online Judge? I watch your CF Profile, You have not solve many problem.What is your practice strategy?

item.title: @-firefly- commented on "Invitation to CodeChef Starters 178 (Rated upto 6 stars) — 19th March"
item.description: The announcement says you will be given a choice to be unrated if your verdict changes.

item.title: @-firefly- commented on "Invitation to CodeChef Starters 178 (Rated upto 6 stars) — 19th March"
item.description: Same here. I guess the checker suffers overflow because I brute force all pairs from high to low.

item.title: @Prady commented on "Invitation to CodeChef Starters 178 (Rated upto 6 stars) — 19th March"
item.description: Same here. There was no announcement as well. The round should be made unrated for the contestants who faced such an issue and got a negative delta.

item.title: @DeadMan69 commented on "Invitation to CodeChef Starters 178 (Rated upto 6 stars) — 19th March"
item.description: Were the testcase for problem A (Div-1) Bigdif changed? Since during contest I had a lot of wrong answers and not it has been converted to correct. Wasted a lot of time trying to debug it :(

item.description: Suggestion: Do you use Inclusive-Inclusive [L,R] ranges or Inclusive-Exclusive [L,R) ranges?Suggestion 2: Do you use node-based (pointer) or array-based segment tree?
